psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Is 56,1]]Thus says the LORD: Observe what is right, do what is just; for my salvation is about to come, my justice, about to be revealed.
[[Is 56,6]]And the foreigners who join themselves to the LORD, ministering to him, Loving the name of the LORD, and becoming his servants-- All who keep the sabbath free from profanation and hold to my covenant,
[[Is 56,7]]Them I will bring to my holy mountain and make joyful in my house of prayer; Their holocausts and sacrifices will be acceptable on my altar, For my house shall be called a house of prayer for all peoples.
first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

gospel.text:
[[Mt 15,21]]At that time Jesus withdrew to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
[[Mt 15,22]]And behold, a Canaanite woman of that district came and called out, "Have pity on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is tormented by a demon."
[[Mt 15,23]]But he did not say a word in answer to her. His disciples came and asked him, "Send her away, for she keeps calling out after us."
[[Mt 15,24]]He said in reply, "I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel."
[[Mt 15,25]]But the woman came and did him homage, saying, "Lord, help me."
[[Mt 15,26]]He said in reply, "It is not right to take the food of the children and throw it to the dogs."
[[Mt 15,27]]She said, "Please, Lord, for even the dogs eat the scraps that fall from the table of their masters."
[[Mt 15,28]]Then Jesus said to her in reply, "O woman, great is your faith! Let it be done for you as you wish." And her daughter was healed from that hour.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

second_reading.text:
[[Rm 11,13]]Brothers and sisters: I am speaking to you Gentiles. Inasmuch then as I am the apostle to the Gentiles, I glory in my ministry
[[Rm 11,14]]in order to make my race jealous and thus save some of them.
[[Rm 11,15]]For if their rejection is the reconciliation of the world, what will their acceptance be but life from the dead?
[[Rm 11,29]]For the gifts and the call of God are irrevocable.
[[Rm 11,30]]Just as you once disobeyed God but have now received mercy because of their disobedience,
[[Rm 11,31]]so they have now disobeyed in order that, by virtue of the mercy shown to you, they too may (now) receive mercy.
[[Rm 11,32]]For God delivered all to disobedience, that he might have mercy upon all.
second_reading.title: Letter to the Romans
